intro_bio: I'm currently a Junior at the University of Texas at Austin,
pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science.
My passions lie in full-stack development, machine learning,
and AI, along with a drive to push the boundaries of what's possible.

section.title: ~/About
section.description: Brief information about me and some of my interests.

bio: I am currently an undergraduate student at the University of Texas at Austin pursuing a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science. I have recently completed internships at Medex Surgical, where I developed an inventory management system, and iCode, where I taught STEM education and assisted students with learning programming languages such as Java and Python. I am also a Research Fellow at the Autonomous Robotics Laboratory, where I work on robotics programming using GPT-4, Python, and C++.

I have a strong interest in full-stack development, machine learning, and AI. I'm constantly looking for opportunities to apply my technical skills to impactful projects, like creating a Chrome extension using OpenAI’s GPT-3.5 or integrating AI into real-world applications. Outside of my technical work, I enjoy working out, watching anime, and spending time with family and friends.

section.title: ~/Education
section.description: Courses that I have completed or am on track to complete.

general.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science

section.title: ~/Experience
section.description: My current/past relevant experience. Click [here](/resume) to view my resume.

experience_items.title: Software Engineering Intern
description: Designed and deployed an inventory management database system to store inventory using Visual Basic for Applications and JavaScript, reducing manual errors by 30% and saving 15 hours weekly for operations.
Streamlined management of over 1.5K hospital items, improving inventory tracking accuracy across 100+ hospitals by 40%.

experience_items.title: Software Engineering Tutor
description: Instructed lessons in Java, Python, and C++ to 20+ students, focusing on hands-on projects to build practical skills.
Identified and resolved a bug in the lesson progress tracking system, preventing a revenue loss of over $2K in profit.
Maintained a 90% satisfaction rate by customizing lessons to meet individual needs and ensure active engagement.

experience_items.title: Research Fellow
description: Collaborated in a team of 4 to develop a multi-robot human guidance system using Robot Operating System (ROS), Python, and C++, leveraging GPT-4o to enable robots to guide people throughout the laboratory building.
Tracked each robot’s real-time location using ROS, integrating it with structured GPT-4o prompts to deliver precise navigation and room directions within the building.

section.title: ~/Projects
section.description: Some of my most recent or past favorite creations or work.

description: Worked in a team of 4 to develop a machine learning model using Python and Jupyter Notebook, aimed at predicting a game’s total global sales. Removed outliers, filled null values, and engineered new features using Pandas, NumPy, and Seaborn to uncover patterns driving global sales. Trained and optimized regression models through hyperparameter tuning, improving the R2 value by 83% from 0.24 to 0.44.

Developed a Chrome extension using JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, leveraging Open-AI’s GPT-3.5 Turbo to generate concise web page summaries. Created scripts to extract web page content and integrated Open-AI API for text summarization functionality.

Designed a full-stack application using Next.js, Firebase, and JavaScript for real-time pantry inventory tracking and secure user authentication. Integrated LLaMA AI to analyze inventory and provide tailored recipe suggestions for the user.

Constructed a recycling detection algorithm in a team of 4, integrating YOLO-8, OpenCV, and GPT-4 to determine an object’s recyclability status. Led system testing using Azure Kinect video streams, achieving a detection accuracy of 78% on recyclable objects.
